text: Strive not for success, but for the values ​​that it gives.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The hardest thing is to start acting, everything else depends only on perseverance.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: One must love life more than the meaning of life.
author: Fedor Dostoevsky

text: Life is what happens to you while you are making plans.
author: John Lennon

text: Your time is limited, don't waste it living someone else's life.
author: Steve Jobs

text: I don't have the word impossible in my dictionary.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

text: You will never cross the ocean unless you have the courage to lose sight of the shore.
author: Christopher Columbus

text: If you think you are capable of something, you are right; If you think that you will not succeed, you are also right.
author: Henry Ford

text: Start doing everything you can do - and even what you can even dream of. In courage, genius, strength and magic.
author: Johann Wolfgang Goethe

text: You just have to believe that you can - and you are already halfway to the goal.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Happiness is not something ready made. Happiness depends only on your actions.
author: Dalai Lama

text: If an inner voice tells you that you cannot draw - draw as much as possible, then this voice will subside.
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: Only those who never try new things never make mistakes.
author: Albert Einstein

text: You learn the fastest in three cases - up to 7 years, at trainings, and when life has driven you into a corner.
author: Stephen Covey

text: Always choose the most difficult path - on it you will not meet competitors.
author: Charles de Gaulle

text: The only happiness in life is the constant striving forward.
author: Emile Zola

text: Before climbing the ladder of success, make sure it is leaning against the wall of the building you need.
author: Stephen Covey

text: Great are those who see that thoughts rule the world.
author: Ralph Emerson

text: The only way to do something very well is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Life is measured not by how many years it has, but by how many years of real life there are.
author: Abraham Lincoln
